DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate the clinical outcomes of intrastromal corneal ring segment (ICRS) implantation to correct keratoconus on eyes with prior refractive surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Intrastromal Corneal Ring for Ectasia After Refractive Surgery (Anel)
DOC.detailed_description: Forty-two eyes of 26 patients, 14 men and 12 women, with ectasia after refractive surgery were studied in a nonrandomized, retrospective, observational case series. Mean age at the time of ICRS implantation was 30,5 years.
DOC.criteria: Patients 19 to 48 years old Keratoconus (ectasia) on eyes with prior refractive surgery Diabetes Autoimmune diseases
